article_title: Why Doctors Are Growing Angrier By The Day in the U.S. and the U.K.
article_text:

twitter.description: There is new drama on the healthcare front. This time, it’s not in the United States, where critics have endlessly dissected the expansion of health coverage since Obamacare was introduced five y...
twitter.title: Why Angry American Doctors Might Follow the British and Strike

article_metadata.keywords: healthcare, health insurance, doctors, physicians, unions, union membership, england, nhs, american medical association, private practice
article_metadata.sailthru.tags: American Medical Association, doctors, england, Health Care, Health Care Spending, Labor Unions, Obamacare, physicians, union membership, unions
article_metadata.description: Doctors in the U.S. are beginning to consider a tactic employed by their peers in England's NHS: a strike.
article_metadata.sailthru.title: Why Angry American Doctors Might Follow the British and Strike
article_metadata.news_keywords: healthcare, health insurance, doctors, physicians, unions, union membership, england, nhs, American Medical Association, private practice
article_metadata.sailthru.description: American doctors are increasingly unhappy over constraints in the way they deliver medical treatment.
